title: Influence of processing conditions on sesame lignan content and wound healing activity of Thai traditional ointment formulations.
abstract: WP255/2 is a Thai traditional wound healing formula documented on the Wat-Phra-Chetuphon (Wat Pho) marble inscriptions. Previous studies have demonstrated its wound healing efficacy in rat models and diabetic patients with chronic foot ulcers. Sesame oil, the major component of WP255/2, plays a key role in the wound healing process, with sesamol identified as a potent bioactive compound involved in these effects.
